review: Service is always amazing, from the moment you walk through the doors to see the smiling hostesses, to the awesome servers, and even the managers and other staff you may meet. The many times I have gone there I have never had a bad experience. The food is always amazing with no flaws. If you want a relaxed meal for a great price go check this place out.

Now keep in mind I have not been here in a couple years so the staff may be completely different (hopefully), but about 5 years ago when I frequented this place, the food was mediocre and the staff all seemed to be indifferent to their customers and were more concerned about their inner-circle social dramas than doing their job.   On one occasion I'm pretty sure our waiter was hung-over or high; he took our drink orders with his eyes half-shut while grunting monosyllabic responses. After he took our drink order, we waited for about 15 min only for him to come back and ask what I had ordered again because he forgot (I'd just asked for a water).  That was just our drinks.  For my dinner, I asked for the flat iron steak, rare without the Jack Daniels sauce.  I had to send it back THREE times:  1st time: well-done with sauce on it.   2nd time: well-done without sauce.  3rd time: rare with sauce on it.  4th: finally got it right. This is the first and last time ever I had to send food back because I generally hate to be that ultra picky customer, but this was ridiculous.  And I realize it's not my waiter's fault because he doesn't make the food, but each time I sent it back he was not apologetic or even nice about.  He acted annoyed with me even though each time the steak was clearly not what I ordered. Well-done and rare are pretty far apart on the done-ness spectrum of steak, and it's sort of obvious when something has sauce on it and when something does not.  My boyfriend at the time was finished eating his meal by the time I finally got my food brought to me correctly prepared, and I had to actually ask  my waiter if we could get a discount or something since it was screwed up so bad so many times.  He rolled his eyes and said he'd have to check with his manager.  Good news is I didn't have to pay for my dinner.

I really like this particular location of this restaurant. My husband and I visit whenever we want a low fat, and filling meal which is the dragon fire chicken that's served with steam brocolli which is always tender and bright green - perfect. They also make a mean mudslide, which is like drinking an alcoholic milkshake - very tasty. I am also pretty pleased with the take out orders - the host/hostess is always very friendly!

Still no wifi ?  Ok so I come in on a tuesday night as I have no power and this is a diversion,  I think about my food going to waste in the refrigerator . Ok maybe I can enjoy an evening out  with something to eat, as I look at the menu the waiter comes over and asks if I have been helped? No I have not , may I ask what do you recommend?  He replies... too eat?  Ok this is good? No extra napkin was to be had , the food comes at the 30 minute mark . Bland  is spot on as others have described . Maybe they haven't heard of Yelp or do not read the reviews. I say pass this one by.

First off the drinks are horrible and barely any alcohol in them and for the price you pay it isn't worth it - I sat down in the bar and there were maybe 3 tables with a few people at each and it took me over 15 minutes to be waited on... I ordered fried green beans and they were burnt... tasted horrible and tasted like the freezer... I decided to try something new off the menu and get the garlic shrimp on the sizzling hot plate.. I got food poisoning from this horrible food.. They left the tails on the shrimp.. (who does that!?) the rice was hard and over cooked... not worth the money!!!!!!
Out late tonight in Manassas, Virginia grabbing a bite to eat with friends. Is really makes me miss the now defunct Kirkland, WA TGI Fridays. Overall good dining experience.

Came here on Memorial Day after seeing all the "New Fridays" ads on the metro. Meatball appetizers were quite good, service was good (but they weren't busy).  The tomato/mozzarella salad side dish was quite good as well as the rest of my meal (JD chicken and the Parmesan steak fries).  The steak fries had sort of a honey-butter sauce sprinkled along with the cheese - quite good!  Happy we stopped back in - will be back.

On November 15, I arrived at Fridays at approximately 7:00pm, which was a peak time. I made sure to tell the hostess we wanted to be seated at "the bar section for happy hour specials" and she replied it was a 15-20 minute wait for that area, which was completely fine. We waited and were seated in the dining room area, before getting comfortable, I asked the young man who sat us if it was okay to sit here for the happy hour specials because we asked to be seated at the bar and he replied "yes, it's fine". So our waiter comes, we ask about drink specials and I ask if the "potstickers were apart of the happy hour special". He says "unfortunately, we don't serve happy hours special in the dining room". I inform him of what the other worker said and he repeats the same thing. I ask if there was a manager he could ask or we could speak to. A manager just so happened to be wiping off a table near us and we tell him the situation. He says he will be back after speaking to the waiter and his demeanor is as if he is going to rectify the situation. The waiter returns to the table and says "unfortunately we can not serve the happy hour special in the dining room, but we can allow you 2 drinks at the happy hour prices" clearly not budging, he repeats the same thing. Needless to say, we left before ordering anything and will not be returning to this location. Thankfully, there is another Fridays in a neighboring city with amazing customer service, Fairfax.

The food was decent and it came out very quickly. Our sever was nice and very talkative. We took advantage of the half price apps. The only complaint of the night would be that we were missing a side of fries and  ended coming out after the main meal was finished.  Overall,  typical Fridays nothing fancy, but open late night so I'll take what I can get.
Cheap food and beer. Wait staff needs help. Can't even change TVs from stupid horse racing.

This is where you ball on a budget for happy hour!  Fellas, get over the fact that is a chain restaurant and open your eyes to the possibility of impressing a chick while making your wallet smile.  (Side note, I don't expect anyone I date to suggest TGIF.  Not happening.) Half price appetizers. $5 drinks. I have walked away full and tipsy for under $30.  Plenty of times. More times than I care to admit.  Thursday nights you can tap your toes to a DJ playing the top 40.  And you if make eye contact with him, he might think it gives him permission to come sit at your booth.  Warning: Do not make eye contact with the DJ. Also, make sure you are a member of the rewards program, because I tend to always get a free meal.  Pass. Shoot. Score.

I typically would not go to TGI Friday's. I can't remember the last time I went to one. And I had no intention of going here last week. I was on the PRTC commuter on the way home from the WFC Metro when suddenly ... mother nature called. And she didn't just call ... she knocked. LOUDLY. I had to take the first stop off the bus when it got into Manassas and go to the nearest public establishment I could find. And that was Friday's. After answering the call, I was pretty much stuck there until my wife picked me up, so I figured I'd take a seat at the bar until I could reach her.  To my surprise, the bar provided a couple of passable selections for brew. Of course, it's heavy on the usual NASCAR suspects, and big imports and microbrews - Stella, Blue Moon, Sam Adams (Lager and Rebel IPA) - but they did have Flying Dog Raging Bitch and Devil's Backbone Eight Point IPA. It's a predictable selection, but better than some of the other chain restaurants, and was a nice surprise.  Friday's does have great happy hour specials on food. Unfortunately, that food is a bit hit or miss. They were offering a number of their appetizers for $3 - a Thursday special - and decided to order their White Cheddar Beef Queso dip. It was pretty good, and a nice portion for the price.  Shortly after, I reached my wife. She was hungry so I suggested we stay and try some of the other appetizers. I had just placed an order of fried green beans, a spinach flatbread, and sirloin hibachi skewers. The skewers were good, but a small portion ... I would be unhappy if I paid full price for this. The flatbread was good, but nothing special. The fried green beans were fine for the first couple of bites, but my wife noted they began to "taste like the fryer". And she was right. Overall, all of the food was passable, but nothing stood out as something I would come back for again.  I will say that the service behind the bar was outstanding - so much that I'd bump them for 2 stars to 2.5 stars. But while Friday's was acceptable for passing the time in an emergency situation, nothing here had me rethinking my opinion of Friday's or make me want to come back again.

Watch out for the steak/anything that has the possibility of being undercooked! Sick for daaaaaaayz, and not in a fun way. Other than that, they have this cool free membership where you can get free chips and ranch when you show up. Holla!

The service was very good and the food was what you would expect from a chain restaurant. Everyone got steaks but they were all temped wrong. That was ok as we were all hungry and we knew it was busy so we did not mention it. The sides were yummy and we did the jack Daniels sampler which we all devoured. Overall a good experience and satisfying food, when in the area we would return. Again, great service!

It's a standard applebee's, tuesdays, chilis, American style copycat restaurant. Your experience here will depend on your server. I have been when it is good and I have had fair. This Fridays is huge compared to others I have been to but they are usually well staffed. The menu changes pretty regularly. Unfortunately one thing that stays is the Jack Daniels bbq. It is too sweet and more of a glaze than a bbq sauce. I do really like their buffalo wing sauce though. It is almost as good as Glory Days. One thing nice is that the bar stays open late with a full menu. I keep it in my regular rotation. It is good for a visit every few months. Especially late night for a burger.

My husband and I have given Fridays our usual 3 strike try and every time have been disappointed. This last time we had the pecan crusted chicken salad, the chicken was disgusting, it tasted like it had been frozen and left on the counter to thaw. Not crispy, crunchy or fresh. The salad was drowned in dressing and lettuce was not fresh the only saving grace for the salad was the mandarin oranges my son ate. We asked for some crackers for my son which the server was great and brought for him which was nice but when we tasted the crackers they were stale....even in the packages so it makes you wonder how old the crackers are. Needless to say we will not be going back.

Came in around midnight since hardly any restaurants stay open late. It was a date night and long overdue so we really went crazy with our budget. (Sat kinda in the bar area in high top booths). Ordered the mozzarella sticks and Ahi tuna chips; both amazing. Ordered margaritas and bottles beer...margarita tasted like a glass full of sweet and sour. Not quite sure if there was any "substance". Had the steak and lobster tails for dinner...the steak was sinewy and chewy despite ordering it Med Rare. Whoever they get their meat from is terrible. Lobster tails tasted good and freshly grilled...but very small. It was more like a steak and mutant crawfish dinner. Our server/bartender (tall guy kinda quiet) was nice. Kinda seemed like he was ready to just get out of there though. I'm guessing this isn't a "fun" place to work. It def wasn't a fun date night. Next time we will head out earlier and go somewhere nicer (like Chili's) lol.

I made an actual complaint to T.G.I. Fridays Head Office - and they sent me the automated email asking for my cell number to discuss further - and never called. They obviously feel they are beyond needing to keep customers happy as they feel they are a big enough corporation.  I will no longer be a patron at any T.G.I. Fridays.

First time coming to TGI and I love this place ! We ordered the unlimited app and it was so good. The service was exceptional!  Our waitress is so so nice and fun! She keeps walking back to our table to check on us!

The conversation went as follows:  Mom: "those potato skins don't look loaded, why do they call them loaded." Me: "they call them loaded because the cook is loaded when he makes them."  In one sentence my meal consisted of "a bunch of unmelted cheese slices".  It gets two stars because the waitress was very nice. Otherwise TGI Fridays has really gone down hill in taste and quality. Not like I should be surprised with a chain restaurant.

10 minutes to get drink order in.  45 minutes total to get food. .. on a tuesday after 7PM.  Waitress was swamped with other tables yet other waitresses weren't busy.  Hostess was clueless when it came to basic seating management.  Water quality is something you generally get right.  Not here.  Pretty close to well water standards with that distinct flavor of metallic weird after taste.  My favorite dish of sizzling chicken and cheese came out quite sizzling.  And burnt.  When you burn food it turns to carbon.  Carbon charred dry chicken and what used to be cheese doesn't taste good.  Basic food science here.  The steak fries, and ribs were cooked correctly.  Broccoli on the other might have been run through the dishwasher.  One bite was enough.  Pleasant waitress, nice atmosphere, clean.  Worst Fridays experience I've had.  Maybe avoid it on Tuesdays.

The service was horrible. My food had be returned to the kitchen and I had to search for my own silverware and napkins. The server was a mess and extremely unprofessional. 10 minutes to be seated with no parties in front of me and over 10 empty and clean tables, 40 min wait for an appetizer, 1hr for a pink burger when I asked for well done and ribs that were too charred to be edible. At 1 hr 20 min my food was brought back out to me and my date was already done. The manager did not come to address any of my problems and I was told they were making up for my experience by giving me the burger for free.  I was going to get the burger for free anyway because I'm a vet. I paid $32.43 for my appetizer and my dates food.  This place is horrible.

nice drink specials...pumpkin spice drink is quite tasty BUT the food is mehhh...hit or miss, more of a miss for me.  I stick with ordering basic stuff like fries or mozzarella sticks...the chicken is fried too hard, sandwiches & meats aren't seasoned...blah blah blah Service at the bar is not too bad, friendly and attentive.

This place gets three for food and one for service ~ averaged 2.  Don't go here there are better places just a few miles towards Manassas in the city.  This was another TGI Fridays.  The Service was so bad we did not finish ordering our meals and had to procure our own drinks..  I will not go back here and would not recommend it.

First time at this particular TGI Friday's tonight. Atmosphere was nice and clean and inviting. Food was okay. There was 4 in our party (2 adults, 1 teen and a child). We got an appetizer (the pick 3 trio): mozzarella sticks, pretzels with cheese dip and boneless wings. The pretzels and mozzarella sticks were amazingly delicious! The boneless wings were a bit overcooked. I ordered the Parmesan chicken entree which came with a tomato and mozzarella salad and macaroni and cheese. The macaroni and cheese was okay, the tomato and mozzarella salad was quite good but the chicken once again was overcooked and dried. My teenage son got the half rack of ribs and sirloin steak with fries and broccoli. His steak was a bit undercooked for his liking, but he ate it anyway. Our daughter's cheeseburger was so dry I could hardly cut it, but she liked the fries. My s/o ordered the Club sandwich and really enjoyed it. We got the brownie for dessert. It wasn't as big (and didn't look much like the picture), but that's typical. The staff was polite. Tara was our waitress and there was another waitress in training. She kept our drinks filled  nicely and was helpful. We will definitely return; just a little concerned with the dryness in the meat.

We tried four different restaurants before coming here on a Sunday night at 7:30. Everywhere else had a 30 minute wait except here. That should have been a sign. We waited about 10 minutes for our waiter to come over. Took another 10 to get our drinks. We ordered the pick 3 and the wings were overcooked to the point that we sent them back. Our waiter did not pay much attention to us at all and when we asked a waitress if she could get him for us I watched her walk right by him in the kitchen and said nothing to him. Very arrogant. We asked for silverware twice and the first time it took him 20+ minutes and he still didn't get it. The second time my boyfriends father had been sitting with his salad in front of him  for  10 minutes waiting to see if the waiter noticed. He didn't so we finally asked again. I liked the Cajun pasta I ordered but the chicken was weird. The table of two next to us was served their food at the same time as us even though they came in 25 minutes after us. I finally got the water I asked for when we first put in our drink orders 5 minutes before we left. Drinks didn't taste like they had any alcohol in them. Overall the service sucked, food was good. I've been here twice before and received better service.

The worst Fridays I have ever went to! I work by this location and it's horrible my girlfriend wrote a review a couple months ago for the same reason! Had to go back to fix our order it's not the guest fault if you were short staffed and a manager has to cook the food that is not the guest fault.....at least do something to put the smile on the guest face! Called three times to complain about my order every time was left on hold for at least 10 minutes and the kicker is we called them placed our food order about 4 o'clock we finally got our food right at about 730! When I first called the place to order the waitress told me it'll be ready in 30minutes that's when she should've told me that they were short staffed and running slow! What makes all this that much worse is when my coworker went to pick up the food the second time the staff behind the bar had the nerve to be talking about me and my complaint and how I act on the phone like this was unjust! Will never go to this Fridays again and will never recommend this Friday's either this place has gone downhill for almost a year now. Will never recomend this place!!!

We tried to go there last night.  Being a Monday evening there were only a few people  there.  We were seated and then waited.  And waited, and waited.......after 15 minutes I got up to complain that all of the half dozen or so waiters or waitresses just walked by us and no one had even stopped to bring us drinks.  After waiting another 5 minutes my wife and I got up and left. The hostess said that our waitress had been called off by the manager, but there were plenty of other wait staff there to help us. People who came in just as we were leaving were helped immediately. This is unacceptable, I have been eating at TGI Friday''s since the 1980's and have never been treated like this.  I will not be back.

TGI Fridays, "original inventor" of the potato skin, has officially slaughtered that delectable treat we have all come to know and love.  Gone are the days when a golden cup of sunshine, complete with flowing melted colby jack cheese and perfectly crisped skin was delivered to you on a dish you could not get fast enough.  The replacement resembles a plastic food-like substance which, unfortunately, tastes even worse than it looks.  You plate arrives complete with squares of presumably potato, topped with a square of cold cheese food (I use the term food loosely.)  Like a square of butter, this cheese food can be picked up easily and remains in tact.  Tasting of stinky feet and plastic, you will immediately spit it out.  Upon complaining, you will come to learn you are not the first to point this out, but will still be charged full price for this garbage.  In fact, the TGI Fridays potato skins available in the freezer section of your local grocery store will not only taste better, but be cheaper.  If you are looking for potato skins (or good customer service...) go elsewhere.

Party of five. 8:45 Saturday night 4/4/15. The place was not packed. It took 45 min. to get our food after we waited 15 min. to place our order and 10 min to be seated with no one in front of us. It seemed the hostesses were preoccupied with some flyers for a promotion or something.  Finally got our food, everything was cold except one pasta dish. My burger was supposed to have grilled onions. The waitress said "they forgot your grilled onions, that's OK isn't it". NO its not but at that time we just ate and left. I usually tip between 20% and 30% I reluctantly did 10%.

As someone else said, this place is hit or miss. We've been three times. Once, the food was good but service was poor. A few months later the food was bad but the service was excellent. We stopped in tonight for a happy hour atmosphere and a small quick bite but got turned away by the hostess and argued with the manager because, apparently, there is no happy hour on Fridays at TGIFridays. I won't be returning to this location.

If Friday's was a remedial math course, my review would be much different. I would have sympathy for the hostess saying the wait was 30 minutes when it was actually 1.5 hours. I would have sympathy for the waiter who couldn't count the menus. Also, I didn't realize I ordered toilet water, it has some bite to it. Not like the alcohol kind. I would give a review on the food, but I haven't got it yet.

COCKROACH UPDATE!  Went to grab a drink (and avoid food) and guess who started crawling up next to me??? Remedy?  Free appetizer voucher for my next visit....Yeah, because more food from you is what I want....already made it a point not to eat there, so no...... Piggybacking on the prior review I wrote (it's still here, where the server CURSED at us)...I come back here because the food is actually good despite the horrible encounters with the service.  Went in today for lunch and have to say that the former is starting to slip as well. We were nearly the only folks there and it took a lifetime, and had a big issue with how some red meat was undercooked. Co-worker ordered a burger, done medium-well, and when it came out it was practically mooing at her.  She cut it, rather than bite it, to see how it was done.  She had them take it back and put it on for a few more minutes because it was absolutely red in the middle.  They clearly did not flip the burger to cook it since they had already put cheese on it - so they took the same burger that was on her plate, put it back on the grill with other peoples fresh food, and then only cooked one side of the burger.  When it came back it was still very very pink in the middle.  I took a picture because I couldnt believe after a re-cooking it still looked like that.   Besides the terribly wrong results, she could have gotten sick...and no one should take food that has been served to you and bring it back to the kitchen after you have started to cut into it; this is why they should also not offer to take your food to put it in a container to-go as they can contaminate other's food.  They should've given her a fresh burger and been done with it.  The waitress looked exasperated that it wasn't done the first time, like she was not surprised.  Methinks I am done here.
Wow has Fridays gone down hill. Dry wings, dry potatoes skins... never going there again.
Don't get the endless apps. You won't finish the first round because they'll arrive cold and depressing. Classic example of excellent service paired with horrible cooks.

Strange things are afoot at the TGI Friday's. Nothing short of abysmal. We went with a party of eight Sunday night around 10pm for some noms. The restaurant was pretty empty, and we were seated right away, and we all decided to go with Endless Apps. It was nothing short of endless disappointment.  The endless wings arrived ice cold. No less than three people were served cold wings, and when I say cold, I'd like to emphasize the wings were somehow colder than the ranch dipping sauce they were served with. Our partially dehydrated potato skins (yes, you read that right) were so crunchy and hard they literally crumbled apart as you ate them. Moisture had long since left these food-like items leaving them flavorless husks, imitations of food that once was. The mozzarella sticks, something Friday's USUALLY gets right, were oddly rubbery in the inside, yet crunchy and hard on the outside. Mm-mmm! Our waiter was pretty cool and worked with us to try to fix the situation, but the food was beyond his (or apparently anyone's) control. The manager knocked off some of the costs of our "food" but didn't have the courtesy to discuss it with us or try to apologize. Apparently, two Friday's staffers outright walked off the job mid-service.

We came here to celebrate and we ended up mourning the loss of what could have been a great dinner. Stone  cold wings, terrible coffee...potato skins where the cheese is still a solid instead if melted and have to take a chisel to them. No way we will come back.

This establishment has someone putting something that can marginally be considered sustenance onto a plate, not a chef. Do they have two kids on each other's shoulders wearing an apron out the back? For our table, the food frequently came out undercooked and cold. Service here could be better as I felt that although it was friendly, it was not formal enough. Looking at Google Map reviews, apparently some of these problems have been going on for months. Someone from QC in corporate really ought to look at this place, not a prospective customer.

Horrible service and horrible food. Food has nice coloring and ok presentation. They have the worst ever servers who don't even know their menu. Ask them a simple question and they don't know the answer.  Their ordering service is very slow and food sometimes come out cold with missing combinations. The place looks nice after their recent remodeling but certainly their  management / staff never changed. This company in my opinions needs a total transformation because I've been to some other location and they are pretty much the same as far food and quality. Don't spend your  money here, just got to chipotle next door.

2 stars.  I stayed at Hampton Inn across the parking lot 2 stars include the convience factor.  Food was good. Presentation was poor.  Both my Bacardi & Cokes w/ double lime wedge had limes with Brown spots on the skin. Wedge Salad was good but was not appealing to the eye.  Sirloin and Shrimp were cooked OK but looked like they were thrown on the plate.  Server smelled of cigarettes.  Clean up the drink, food and server presentation and this would be a solid 3 maybe 3.5 stars...

Bottom line up front: you can do better.  Greasy fries, over cooked shrimp. Dirty floors, loud noise. I realize the server isn't at fault. He's trying hard.  But not seeing much movement from the staff, and the cooks - well, if I can tell it was frozen, I can order from Giant and microwave it for a lot less, and learn not to over cook it too. Also, I get that the wedding party of 12 gets better attention for a better tip. But how about the front reception and back room staff pick up some service to expedite. And if the manager could not interrupt your table service with a "Comp that group over there with free drinks", it might make me feel less like "never coming back."

Food was average. Service was poor. Restaurant was not crowded but greeter acted as if getting a table was a major burden. Waitress never asked if anyone needed refills. Had to remind her twice to bring plates and silverware. Forgot a beer for 15 minutes then brought it without a word of apology. Bill was wrong and we were overcharged by $30. Again, no apology from the waitress. Food was ok but nothing special and took very long to be served.  No one (including the waitress) asked if everything was ok. Bad experience overall. Do not recommend.

Just left this location with a bad taste in my mouth. I ordered a glass of peach sangria and an appetizer sampler with traditional buffalo wings, potato skins, and mozzarella sticks. The wings were cold compared to the rest of the food, but overall tasted yummy. The potato skins lacked seasoning and flavor, and the mozzarella sticks were more breading than cheese. What left a fowl taste in my mouth though, was the check. My ONE glass of sangria was $11.29!! That's only $2 less than my food! Of course there were no prices on their alcohol menu, but I couldn't imagine that it would be more than $7-$8, WRONG! The drink was good, but an iced down wine is not worth that kind of money, they should be ashamed of themselves.

The stop to catch a quick drink was a crazy move, the bartender needs more work on providing drinks. This was whack! I was asked too many times if I wanted anything else after I stated I will let you know. The customer service needs improvement, the staff ...smh  Back to the drink I was given, it was too much sour mix. Whomp whomp do better. Thanks
Stopped in for Veterans Day for supposed free meal,  only to find out after my order was placed  that carry out wasn't free. Would've been nice to know prior to ordering.

Went here on a Friday night. Was ecstatic because of the endless apps deal going on. My boyfriend and I both placed Our orders and ordered our drinks. My drink was tasty with the right amount of alcohol. My first appetizer of mozzarella sticks  came out. They were perfectly crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside. Before I could gobble down the last mozzarella stick my boyfriend told me I was about to freak out. I asked him why only knowing that it could be one thing. Checked my peripherals, and there was a baby roach crawling along side our booth. I calmly gathered my things and moved to the other side of the booth with him. We then debated about what we would do from this point. Neither him or I had an appetite thereafter and his entree hadn't arrived yet. I started to give the place a glance and noticed how nasty the floors were with napkins crumbs etc. by this time my boyfriend had killed the roach and I do believe management(as we made direct eye contact) saw him do it but yet did not come over. Our waiter came back and we told him the situation in which it seemed like he wanted to tell us something more about the situation but knew it would be inappropriate on the behalf of the company. Each time he wanted to say something he cut it off, my boyfriend and I both came to the same conclusions of what he was trying to say. Being he was a great waiter, he let us go ahead and leave and he went to talk to his manager. We both left disappointed and disgusted with our delicious drinks still filled to the rim.

Good for drinks, but I was also dumb enough to eat the food.  How can flatbreads be greasy?  Fridays has figured out a way.....I was camped out in the bathroom the whole next day after my dinner here.  I came back the following night and the bartender remembered my drink, plus 1 star.  I tried the endless wings and they just.....sucked!  (they were cool enough to remove them from my bill) Like most of the reviews seem to say for this location....Ugh, Ick, Nope! If I'm nearby again I'm going somewhere else!

Consensus of 2 stars is about right. Our waiter abandoned us, luckily another saw our need and got out drinks refilled and cleared the table when we were done.  Then we waited another while for the check. Food was OK but slow, especially for the few people in here.  Staff seems unprofessional and worst, inattentive.

Three stars on the food, five stars on the staff, so averaging to four. Staff very attentive, professional, courteous -- more so than the average Fridays. Food was prepared flawlessly and was tasty, everyone liked what they had in our group. Seemingly stale, hard buns on the burgers. Coke had an apparent dispensing problem and was not mixed right -- very weak. Seems you should get more fries with a $12 burger. Would go back.

First time here. The place as a whole was run down totally. I mean cracks in the walls and paint chips everywhere. Dreary environment really..except for sayed. Sayed was full of smiles and pleasant. He is the reason for the 3rd star. All the severs and the hostess were smiley and nice. Roast beef dip was good and chicken fingers. Apparently they are getting ready for their new seasonal menu but honestly, they need restaurant rescue in there.

I used to work at this Fridays. I loved the food then but I stopped going because the food and service has gotten worse every time I'm there. Last time I went I got a drink and breadsticks because they used to be the  ! How in the world do breadsticks suck so bad! Step your game up Friday's!

Came in for lunch on a Saturday. Not too many people there for a Saturday afternoon. Service was slow. Waitress needed smoke signals to figure out that you needed her. Found hair in side salad (small black hair) which was definitely not mine. No apology or anything just asked if I wanted another one or if I wanted it off the bill. No manager came over to apologize or anything.  Over $13 for 3 appetizers that were small portions. 2 pretzels sticks, 4 potato skins, and 4 Mozarella sticks. Not impressed with service or quality of food.  Not worth the visit when there are so many options in Manassas.

Appetizers were ok, the wings and pretzels were good. The mixed drinks were bad. The food was extremely greasy, I got the Jack Daniels burger. The sauce was really good but the grease was overwhelming. The environment is very upbeat with good servers.
As we were being seated another waitress from behind cuts of my boyfriend to pass and then says excuse me super loud and rudely, instead of waiting 2 seconds for us to sit.

First time here because I was in the area. Came in for the endless appetizers. Waiter was good, checked up on us decent amount of times so no complaints there. Only real complaint was that the food tasted warm. Given it's endless app's, I also ordered a salmon with sweet potato fries and the fries were warm and tasted like they were barely cooked, just eh. Three stars for the waiter and ok food. Would I go back? Probably not.
Sucks.. all we can say.. the waitress was rude.. they made us feel uncomfortable by talking about us with other staff and pointing at our table..

Meh, in retrospect I probably should have just went to my room. Upon arriving back to my hotel after dinner, I noticed the hotel was right next door to a TGI Fridays.  I thought for a minute, kicking the tires on whether or not I should head over for a night cap when my legs began moving me there without any help from my brain. Walking in I notice the restaurant is a little messy.  I notice a decent amount of tables littered with dirty plates and empty glasses.  I also notice the floor is in need of a sweep as there was plenty of food and rubbish scattered about.  I don't let this sway me.  I reach the bar and settle in and notice they have a special on Monday nights  1/2 off Martinis.  Score.  So I finally get the attention of the bartender who explains they only do the special until 10 o'clock.  I said lucky for me buddy it's hardly even 8.  He goes on to say sorry I have had a really long day.   I have had long days myself and can't recall losing two hours.   I order the Espresso Martini, which is normally $6.00, but is $3.00 right now.  He explains to me they are out of martini glasses.  Hmm, I was not aware that the glass was included with the drink!  That after you consume your beverage, pack your glasses up with your leftovers!  No, you are not out of martini glasses, you just aren't washing them.  I said whatever just get me the drink.  The martini wasn't bad for $3.00, although I would have never paid $6.00.   My mind was telling me to pack it up but it was still early and I figured I would get one more since it was so cheap.  I should have listened to my mind.  Go figure.  I ask the bartender for one more, he grabs the receipt he has sitting in an empty glass in front of me, proceeds to add another drink to it, prints new receipt, tosses old receipt, and walks away to the other side of the bar.  Wait where is he going?  Why is he talking to another employee?  What?  Now he is getting a drink for someone else at the other end of the bar?  About 5 minutes pass and he makes him way back to where I was seated and I yell out hey buddy you going to make that drink for me or what?  He looks confused, but I guess quickly remembers and begins apologizing through the means of telling me all of his problems like "it's been a long day", "this is my second job", "I am the only bartender, and I have to get drinks for everyone, including the customers at the tables."  Yeah I know how the job of bartender works geeze. Lastly he tells me he is going to quit his other job so he can focus on this place.  I'm not sure he is making the right decision. After securing my last drink, I am in a hurry to settle up so I can bolt at any time when I notice I was charged full price for the Martinis.  It wasn't a big deal I caught it and he fixed it right away, but that coupled with the other strange events of this short stay, I would most likely not return if back here on business.

Sooo...one star because a. I can't leave zero stars and b. At least the host had a pleasant smile and equally pleasant, genuine demeanor.   I'm actually writing this as I sit waiting over 20 minutes for a server to materialize and at least ask us if we would like some fresh tap water . Still writing, still no server.  And there is a strange smell emanating from the rafters. Oh well.  So much for that.  Guess I'll go home and raid the fridge.  Or maybe run across the street to Chilis. Seriously, the service here sucks.
Our waitress was very rude. We had a simple request and she said no. I asked why and she said "I'm too tired to argue." I will not be going back.
I'm tired of finding long dirty black hair in my food. Everytime I come here I either find hair or get the wrong order. I think I'm officially done eating at any TGI Fridays locations.

We haven't been to a TGI Friday for a very long time, and it's our first time here with some friends.  We were around 6 pm, and there was a small crowd around the bar for happy hour and $5 appetizers. Our host was very friendly, and our server was more than happy to explain the menu to us.  We don't want to get our server in trouble but our server was more than hapy to help us with the $3 long island tea and $3 margarita, eventhough we weren't sitting in the bar.  Wife ordered the $10 endless appetizers.  My wife says the boneless chicken wings with garlic and parmesan cheese was good, and Sriacha buffao wings were too spice.  The flatbread pizza was also pretty good.  Fried dumplings were to dry.  Mozzarella sticks were okay.   Our server got a good sense of timing.  After my wife finished one app, our server had another app ready to serve.  I had the ribeye with Jack Daniel sauce, and the sauce was soooo good.  The mac and cheese with bread crumbles on top was pretty good.  The coleslaw was okay.  Our friends enjoyed the Mahi Mahi and the ribs. Overall, the service was awesome.  The drinks were good and the food was pretty good.  We definitely plan to come back again.

The management needs to be replaced!!! We had to wait 30 minutes for a table despite there being available tables. Then after ordering. We had to wait for our first courses of appetizers for over 45 minutes. Some of our next round of appetizers came out cold! So we had to send them back. When we ordered refills on our drinks, our waiter being poorly trained had forgotten them couple times and then we were told they had to reuse the cups. First off that is unprofessional and disgusting for a sit down non-fast food restaurant. As we were leaving at 9:00 a couple walked in and were told to wait 45 minutes, even though the place was at most a third full.
Sat at the bar and Ashley took care of us, great $10 endless apps. Love the meatballs and pot stickers!

Okay I know it's just a TGIF but I mean $10 for endless appetizers... you can't go wrong (although unless your a 200 lb man or any man really you're not going to eat all those potato skins no matter what you think). Okay- here's a tip: it's never actually on the menu but you can order a mudslide at TGI Fridays and they're delicious (I mean maybe all mudslides are pretty much delicious) but that's what I always get. ALSO TGIF has a new drink the "Boba Long Island Ice Tea" and basically it's a Long island ice tea with "bubbles" aka juicy bursts of mango in it. I'm not saying you should start getting your bubble tea at Fridays... but it's fun. Also shout out to our waitress Angelica who was awesome. Tip your waitresses well y'all.
Drinks were shit was sent back manager used the "recipe " excuse we have came before the drink has never been this poor. Service is slow. Will not be back !

Horrible experience. The hostess was very unprofessional claimed to two associates and a guest that I was rude and gave her attitude when all I asked why a different customer was service prior to me.. Because of her she made me feel extremely uncomfortable and sat us at the worst table possible.

We hadn't been to a Fridays in several years. Mainly because of the food quality. In kind of a  last minute decision for dinner we decided on Fridays. The only reason I am giving them 3 stars is because of their service. The hostess greeted us and was very pleasant. Our server was very attentive asking if we needed refills, making sure we were satisfied with our meals. I even asked if the spinach was frozen and he was willing to go check. I didn't have him check. I just went with something different. The food....was a disappointing. I ordered the grilled salmon without the parmesan butter. I substituted the spinach for the tomato mozzarella salad. For the price, the portion size of the salmon seemed a bit high, but that wasn't the most disappointing. There was no flavor. I had to add salt. The same for the tomato mozzarella salad. My husband ordered the ribeye. It was cooked unevenly. He ordered it medium and it went from well done on one end to rare on the other. The mashed potatoes were thick enough to use as spackle. Luckily, our server was friendly and we were able to forgive some of it. We probably won't be going back any time soon.

I'll say the drink specials are decent. That's about it. I wouldn't recommend eating here. The food tastes just like it was made a week before you ordered it. So with that being said if you order food, get ready to camp out in the bathroom.

I think this location only survives because of its proximity to hotels.  We have been here more than once and the service has always been poor.  Tonight we sat at a high table near the bar.  It was not busy; but we waited to order drinks, waited to order food, waited a long time for food, waited for refills, and waited to pay.  Often we had to flag someone down because no one checked on us.  There were two servers/bartenders in the area.

I have been here a few times and always had a pleasant experience. The food is pretty good as well as the prices. Service can be hit or miss but generally it has been decent. I am part of their loyalty program so being able to use my points here is awesome.
I love coming here!. Service always i mean always great!!  Food is always fresh!. I love coming here the servers  are nice, always smilig and very helpful.

Worst place I've ever been too. Rude staff, even worse management. The only one who seemed to genuinely care was the bartender. Oh that's right, I had to get up to go to the bar to get my family non alcoholic beverages. Waited over and hour for soup, salad and a steak. 6 different people tending to our table. Manager and waitress were observed chit chatting with another table the entirety of our dinner, bouncing a baby around the bar and not washing hands after playing with said child. Worst possible experience as a pregnant woman who just wanted the endless apps, and a soup and a salad. FIRE THE NIGHT TIME MANAGER ASAP. I've never had a good experience at this location with the same manager on the floor.

Wow we had the worst service here, ever!! We've come here a few times and we enjoy the drink specials and even some of the food but the service was never great. This time we sat down in a booth by the bar and we were there for 15 minutes and no one came to our table, the bartender even came from around in front of the bar and walk right past us and didn't even give us one look we promptly got up and left. This will be the last time that we come here.

We took our grandchildren here to celebrate both of their birthdays.  First, I will say there were six in our party and our server Jamil didn't even write down our orders and they were complicated.  We really expected to have some mix ups but everything was perfect even down to my granddaughter's seltzer water!   So after we were finished and waiting for our bill my daughter took our grandson across the street to pick up Baskins birthday cake and our 12 year old granddaughter stayed with us.   Well, she had wrapped her "braces" in a napkin before eating and when Jamil came to take away some empty dishes the napkins went with them.  We realized it about 5 minutes later and were freaking out.  The manager, Jamil and other servers all pitched in to find the "braces"...... This was just awesome for the manager (don't know his name) and his employees to all work together.   I applaud them all!   The food was all delicious... mozarella sticks, sliders, sizzling chicken, sirloin steak, broccoli cheese soup...Thank you again !!

I had a great meal! The ambiance was awkward and different than any other Friday's but it worked. I almost couldn't find the boat  but it was up against the wall.  I went for a good old burger and that's exactly what I got.  I debated on going for the new Mac and cheese burger but I wanted pork so the bacon  burger  did the job.  My wife got ribs and I didn't get to try them but if I do I'll give them a review. The burger was cooked to perfection and the service was okay.  We ordered some soup after seeing the waitress bring some to another table but incidentally our food came out first so we canceled the order. Because who wants soup after your entree?!?

Came here with some friends the other night, we were greeted promptly and sat in a large booth. Our server was friendly and attentive and made sure we had enough time to finish our appetizers before we received out entree. Overall great food and nice environment.
Great place. Surprised by the ratings made on yelp, it is disturbing. Liked their service and burgers. Even if I try I wouldn't be able to leave negative review if this place.
